intro: Aeschynomene manipurensis, commonly known as the purpleleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It has been studied for its potential in phytoremediation due to its ability to accumulate heavy metals. Additionally, it is used in traditional medicine in some regions for its purported health benefits.
